title: Studio I: Photography
description: Graduate level studio photography course.

title: Acting for Motion Capture
description: Fundamentals and techniques of acting for motion capture for animation and video game characters.

title: Studio II: Photography
description: Graduate level studio photography course.

title: Women in the Directors Chair
description: A focus on female directors throughout history, their films, stories, and impact. Crosslisted with FLM 105.

title: Cinematic Language
description: Explore the big picture" of the filmmaking process, including the elements and key personnel involved with development, pre-production  production, post-production, and distribution."

title: WWII & The Movies
description: An examination of the films from 1940 to 1960. The emergence of Film Noir, the rise of suspense and the changes in American zeitgeist and American attitudes will be explored. Cross-listed with FLM 103.

title: Easy Riders & Raging Bulls: 1970s Indie Cinema
description: Survey of the independent films of the 1970s, their aesthetics, messages and impact. Cross-listed with FLM 170.

title: Feminine Identity and the Disney Film
description: An exploration of the female roles in animated Disney films. Cross-listed with FLM 116.

title: Film Criticism
description: Study and development of the ability to critically and professionally analyze, discuss  and write about film.

title: "Bollywood": Hindi Cinema
description: Examination of the musical-based genre films of India. Cross-listed with FLM 186.

title: The Musical
description: Examination of the cinematic interpretation and presentation of musicals. Cross-listed with FLM 164.

title: The Silent Film
description: This class explores the films and filmmakers of the silent film era. Cross-listed with FLM 185.

title: Asian Cinema
description: A survey of the films and filmmakers of Asian Cinema. Cross-listed with FLM 161.

title: Science Fiction & Human Rights
description: Both historically and contemporarily, the film genre of science fiction has been utilized to expose and explore significant human rights topics. These will be examined and analyzed for their continued relevancy to human rights issues of our times. The Mount film program's Robert Harrington Film Collection will be used in this course. Cross-listed with FLM 177.

title: From Graphic Novel to Screen
description: This course explores cinematic adaptations of graphic novels and how they reflect issues in our society and promote social justice. Various forms of media will be analyzed including film  television, video games and internet programming. Cross-listed with FLM 169.

title: Heroes, Villains, and Warriors
description: The central place of the action drama in Hollywood, both historically and contemporarily are explored. In addition, the social and psychological impact of action cinema is analyzed. Cross-listed with FLM 158.

title: A History of Romance
description: This course will explore the evolution of romance films from the earliest years of cinema to the present. The changing representation of gender  the ideal types of the male and female romantic  and as the major influence on social roles and expectations are examined. Cross-listed with FLM 179.

title: Cowboy Cinema
description: The history of the Western film genre is central to the history of film and television, as well as American identity, culture, and ethics. A survey of seminal works in this genre will be viewed and analyzed. The Mount film program's Robert Harrington Film Collection will be used in this course. Cross-listed with FLM 149.

title: Suspense Horror & Mayhem
description: A comparative exploration and analysis of the culture of fear and sensationalism as expressed and visualized through themes of suspense  horror  and Armageddon narratives, and how these genres reflect mass culture and influence individual and social behavior or act as agents of social change. Cross-listed with FLM 178.

title: History of American Cinema
description: An advanced survey course on the history of filmmaking, students engage the films and filmmakers that developed and shaped the industry in the United States. Cross-listed with FLM 132.

title: Indusry & Entertainment Seminar
description: Survey course exploring the structure, standard practices, and business of the film and television industry.

title: History of Animation
description: Exploration of the development and history of 2D and 3D animation.

title: Genre Studies: Noir
description: Study of Film Noir, its characteristics and impact on film, television, and video games, and the social, political, and economic factors that led to its development.

title: Special Topics in Producting
description: Unique courses that reflect special areas of research or interest by various faculty members and visiting lecturers. May be repeated for credit.

title: Film Marketing
description: Exploration of the structures and techniques of marketing film and television content.

title: Producing 2
description: Management skills, strategies, budgeting, and practices necessary to bring a film project from conceptualization to the marketplace.

title: Production Management
description: Management skills, strategies, and practices necessary to bring a media project from conceptualization, through production to the marketplace. Discussion includes issues related to working with creative talent, directors  assistants, artistic teams, crew, and multiple other entities involved in the production process. Cross-listed with FLM 154.

title: Producing 1
description: Management skills, strategies, budgeting, and practices necessary to bring a film project from conceptualization to the marketplace.

title: Audio Production & Recording Principles
description: Students will engage in recording, mixing and producing professional audio for live performances and studio applications. Hands on instruction will include microphone placement and recording techniques with a variety of applications and instruments. Students will also work with hardware and software mixers equalizers, compressors, and FX units. Cross-listed with FLM 138.

title: Color Correction
description: Exploration and application of the theories and techniques involved with color manipulation in the post-production process.

title: Editing 1: AVID 101
description: Instruction and hands on application of the techniques and theories of the art of editing with Avid’s Media Composer software. Part one of a two course cycle for Avid certification. Led by an Avid Certified Instructor. Cross-listed with FLM 140A.

title: Editing 2: AVID 110
description: Continued instruction and hands on application of the techniques and theories of the art of editing with Avid’s Media Composer software. Part two of a two course cycle for Avid certification. Led by an Avid Certified Instructor. Cross-listed with FLM 140B.

title: Special Topics in Audio

title: Music Production for Visual Media 2
description: Further exploration of digital music for film and television, web sites, video games, and other interactive media. Exploration and analysis of music and its function in various forms of media. Coursework will include producing, recording  arranging and manipulating music for digital distribution using MIDI, loops, digital audio workstations and virtual instruments. Cross-listed with FLM 152B.

title: Music Production for Visual Media 1
description: An introduction to digital Music for film and television, web sites, video games, and other interactive media. Exploration and analysis of music and its function in various forms of media. Coursework will include producing, recording  arranging and manipulating music for digital distribution using MIDI, loops, digital audio workstations and virtual instruments. Prior music experience is helpful though not required. Cross-listed with FLM 152A.

title: Post-Production Audio 2
description: Exploration of the Pro Tools audio platform and advanced techniques of post-production sound. Led by an Avid Certified Instructor. Cross-listed with FLM 143B.

title: Audio Storytelling
description: Exploration and application of the techniques and technology of producing fiction and non-fiction content through the medium of sound. Radio news packages, dramatizations, podcasting, interview techniques, soundscape creation, utilization of audio to tell a story for the theater of the mind. Cross-listed with FLM 115.

title: New Media
description: Exploration of new forms of storytelling and evolving technology.  Students develop material for non-traditional media applications and explore distribution strategies for story content in emerging media markets. Cross-listed with FLM 118.

title: Cinema Production 2
description: Exploration and application of the use of digital cameras, lenses, and lighting techniques for cinematic storytelling.

title: Cinematography 1
description: Advanced cinematography techniques utilizing professional cameras, lenses, and lighting in studio and location settings.

title: Cinema Production 1
description: Exploration and application of the use of digital cameras, lenses, and lighting techniques for cinematic storytelling.

title: Special Topics in Writing
description: Unique courses that reflect special areas of research or interest by various faculty members and visiting lecturers. May be repeated for credit.

title: Introduction to Digital Video Production
description: This course introduces foundational concepts in the areas of camera, lighting, audio, and editing used in the creation of digital video content. Cross-listed with FLM 139A.

title: Documentary Storytelling
description: Exploration of the styles and approaches of crafting powerful stories utilizing the documentary format.

title: Writing for Television
description: Focus on writing stories for television in the serial or episodic format.

title: Screenwriting 2
description: Cultivating the art of writing for the screen from conceptualization, research, and development to completion of an original product.

title: Screenwriting 1

title: Special Studies

title: Senior Capstone
description: Student with senior standing completes a substantial final project based on area of emphasis or desired focus (by department advisement).

title: Internship
description: Hands-on observation and experience at a film or television studio, or media marketing organization. Internship site is to be selected and agreed upon by both student and Program Director. For majors and minors only. Student must be able to provide own transportation to internship site.

title: Internship
description: Hands-on observation and experience in an industry related company, setting, or other career-building organization. For majors and minors only. Student must be able to provide own transportation to internship site. Prerequisite PHO 2 or FLM 139A.

title: Internship
description: Hands-on observation and experience in an industry related company, setting, or other career-building organization. For majors and minors only. Student must be able to provide own transportation to internship site. Prerequisite PHO 2 or FLM 139A.
